Fast Fashion Sumbang Limbah, Desainer Gelar Fashion Rhapsody
03 Nov 2019, 03:00 by Eka Wahyu Pramita, Mila Novita
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Industri fashion kerap dikaitkan dengan isu lingkungan. Fast fashion yang identik dengan pakaian murah dan cepat berganti model dituding sebagai salah satu penyumbang limbah terbanyak di dunia.
Hal itu memunculkan ide acara Fashion Rhapsody dengan tema berbeda. Acara ini bertujuan agar semua orang lebih sadar akan isu lingkungan serta menjadikan harmoni antara manusia dan bumi agar saling menjaga.
Ide Fashion Rhapsody dicetuskan oleh empat orang perancang busana kenamaan di Indonesia, yaitu Ariy Arka, Ayu Dyah Andari, Chintami Atmanagara, dan Yulia Fandy.
Desainer dan Founder Fashion Rhapsody 2020 Ariy Arka mengatakan inisiatif ini berangkat dari isu pencemaran lingkungan akibat limbah fashion. "Kita kan selalu mengambil beberapa elemen dari bumi, sebagai tempat dimana kita mengumpulkan inspirasi, tentu kita harus lebih care dengan bumi dan begandengan tangan menyelamatkan bumi lewat fashion industry," ucap Ariy di Jakarta, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Menurut Ariy sampah dan limbah fashion sudah banyak sekali. Brand fast fashion rupanya memiliki tingkat mass production yg sangat tinggi, sisa kain yang tidak terpakai limbah. Lalu pengemasan yang menggunakan kantung plastik juga turut berkontribusi.
"Kita mengajak teman desainer untuk mencari solusi. Ada bahan yang mudah diserap oleh bumi dalam waktu 3 bulan selain plastik. Limbah potongan kain bisa untuk aksesori, boneka, keset atau yang bisa digunakan untuk keperluan sehari-hari. Ayo saling bergandengan tangan dan menyuarakan ini," ajaknya.
Sisa potongan kain berkolaborasi dengan mitra binaan yang membuat boneka dari sisa-sisa kain. Ia mengatakan akan merekrut teman-teman yang belum ada pekerjaan agar daya kreatifitas mereka bisa menjadi ladang rezeki. Kain sisa juga bisa dijadikan detail dalam busana.
Dalam naungan Yayasan Cipta Kreasi Mulia, event Fashion Rhapsody: Harmoni Bumi kini lebih mengukuhkan diri secara hukum dan diharapkan menjadi acara yang akan dilaksanakan setiap tahun.
Fashion Rhapsody bekerja sama dengan Mall Kota Kasablanka sebagai tempat digelarnya Road to Event Fashion Rhapsody dan Jakarta Tourism Forum (JTF). Acaranya akan dilaksanakan pada Februari 2020 mendatang di The Tribrata, Jakarta Selatan.

Fast Fashion Donates Waste, Designers Hold Fashion Rhapsody
03 Nov 2019, 03:00 by Eka Wahyu Pramita, Mila Novita
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The fashion industry is often associated with environmental issues. Fast fashion which is synonymous with cheap clothes and fast changing models is blamed as one of the biggest contributors to waste in the world.
That gave rise to the idea of the Fashion Rhapsody event with a different theme. This event aims to make everyone more aware of environmental issues and make harmony between humans and the earth so that they look after each other.
Rhapsody Fashion Ideas was coined by four famous fashion designers in Indonesia, namely Ariy Arka, Ayu Dyah Andari, Chintami Atmanagara, and Yulia Fandy.
Rhapsody 2020 Fashion Designer and Founder Ariy Arka said the initiative departed from the issue of environmental pollution due to fashion waste. "We always take some elements from the earth, as a place where we gather inspiration, of course we must care more about the earth and hand in hand to save the earth through the fashion industry," Ariy said in Jakarta, Friday, November 1, 2019.
According to Ariy, there is a lot of garbage and fashion waste. The fast fashion brand apparently has a very high mass production rate, the rest of the fabric is unused waste. Then packaging using plastic bags also contributed.
"We invite our designer friends to look for solutions. There are materials that are easily absorbed by the earth within 3 months besides plastic. Waste pieces of fabric can be for accessories, dolls, doormats or can be used for everyday purposes. Come hand in hand and speak this voice , "he asked.
The remaining pieces of cloth collaborate with the foster partners who make dolls from the fabric remnants. He said he would recruit friends who did not have jobs so that their creativity could become a source of sustenance. The remaining fabric can also be used as a detail in clothing.
Under the auspices of the Cipta Kreasi Mulia Foundation, the Rhapsody Fashion event: Harmony of the Earth is now more legally established and is expected to be an event to be held every year.
Fashion Rhapsody cooperates with Kota Kasablanka Mall as a venue for the Road to Fashion Rhapsody Event and the Jakarta Tourism Forum (JTF). The event will be held in February 2020 at The Tribrata, South Jakarta.
